title.narrative: Enhance Reproductive Rights to Reduce Violence Against Women in Gaza Province

description.narrative:
Pathfinder received funding from UN Women to reduce violence against women (VAW) and to provide treatment and support for survivors of VAW in Gaza Province. In the Enhance Reproductive Rights to Reduce Violence Against Women in Gaza Province, Pathfinder worked in partnership with the Provincial Directorates of Women and Social Affairs, Health, and Justice in Gaza; the police; Cabinets of Assistance to Women and Children Victims of Violence; local NGOs; the Human Rights League; the Center for Human Rights at University Eduardo Mondlane; the Network of Men for Change; and the national women’s network, Forum Mulher, to establish a sustainable, coordinated approach to VAW.
Pathfinder improved knowledge of and attitudes toward VAW and increased access to health, social, and legal services for women and girls who have been the victims of violence. Other key outcomes of this project were an increase in the number of government sectors and local organizations implementing existing gender and VAW policies and laws and dissemination of the recently approved Domestic Violence Law.

participating-org.narrative: Center for Women and Children Victims of Domestic Violence (NHAMAI)
